intro: Tricalysia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically display bright red or yellow colors. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
